rukus.text: (Allah swears) by the star, as it sets
Your companion, (Muhammad, SAW), did not err, nor was he duped
For, he does not speak what he wishes
(Instead), it is the revelation sent to him
A mighty being has taught him
The one with strength, (the angel Gibra´eel) who manifested himself (in his true form)
At the highest horizon
He then, came closer and hovered
He was two bow-lengths away, or (even) less
Thus, he conveyed to the servant of Allah the revelation
(The prophet´s) mind did not refute what he saw
Would you then quarrel with him, concerning what he (actually) saw
And he, (Muhammad, SAW), certainly saw the angel (in his true form) another time, too
Near the farthest bound of the Lotus tree
Close by, is the abode of the (promised) paradise
The Lotus tree was veiled over by (the nameless splendor), that which covered it (entirely)
He (Muhammad, SAW) was not awe-struck, or aghast; nor did his eyes stray
He definitely saw one of the greatest signs of his Lord
Have you, (oh idolaters), considered (the reality of) ´Laat´ and ´Uzza´ _ (the false goddesses of Arabia)
And the third, the ´Manaat´ _ (the other false goddess)
(What)? the male offspring are for you, (humans) and for Him are the females
This is, of course, an unfair allocation

These are nothing but names that you and your forefathers have conjured up. Allah has not granted any sanction for it. Although guidance from their Lord has certainly come to them, yet they merely follow their (guesses and) hunches, or whatever their desires dictate
Should man have whatever he desires
But to Allah belongs the end, (the life-to-come), as well as the beginning, (the life of this world)
